III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section
Description
1

(1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 08/15/2024 around 8:00am Staff 1 was verbally aggressive.
He told Youth A to get the "fuck" away from him. It is unknown
what Youth A did to trigger this response from Staff 1.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via phone on 8/15/2024 and at
the facility face to face on 8/16/24. She reported Youth A told
her Staff 1 told Youth A to “get the fuck away from me”. Youth A
reported not understanding why Staff 1 would say this. Staff 1
walked up to Complainant and Youth A and told Youth A that if
Youth A knew how to talk appropriately and mind Youth A’s
boundaries then the situation would not have happened.
Complainant reported not knowing what the situation was.
Complainant reported not hearing Staff 1 swear but since staff
swearing is against policy, she was required to report the
allegations. Complainant asked Youth A why the situation
occurred, and Youth A told her Youth A was asking a question of
Staff 1. She reported never hearing Staff 1 swear around the
youth.
Administrator 2 was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/16/2024. He reported being aware of the allegations and that
Staff 1 has no discipline action in his HR file. He reported his
knowledge of the situation came from Complainant. After receiving
this information, Staff 1 was moved to another unit and
Administrator 2 spoke with Staff 1 later in the day. He reported
Staff 1 informed him Youth A was struggling with personal space
issues and after being redirected a couple of times to avoid
others, Youth A went into the personal space of another youth.
Staff 1 told Administrator 2 that Staff 1 informed Youth A that Staff
1 would speak directly to Youth A’s staff that Youth A should
forfeit his game time for the numerous violations of personal
space. Administrator 2 reported Youth A has a history of making
false allegations and swearing is a common allegation made by
Youth A. Administrator 2 also reported there was an incident in
which staff swore but this was investigated by licensing
(2024C0001148SI).
2

Youth A was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/16/2024. Youth A reported Staff 1 didn’t swear at Youth A but
believes it may have been a female staff that swore at him. He
reported Staff 1 told Youth A to get out of his space in a manner
that Youth A found to be rude. The rudeness of Staff 1 was
reported by Youth A to be talking too fast to Youth A. Youth A
reported Youth B was present.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/16/2024.. Youth B reported never hearing Staff 1 swear but did
note that Youth A was upset. Youth B reported understanding
Youth A was upset because Youth A could not have something,
but Youth B didn’t know what this “something” was. Youth B
reported hearing Youth A tell Staff 1 that Staff 1 better mind his
own business to which Staff 1 responded with “I am minding my
own business”. Youth B reported the incident took place in the
morning because Staff 1 was moved to another unit.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/16/2024. Youth C reported he may have heard the “F” word but
was unable to identify where he heard it. He reported this
occurred when a staff (unidentified) was speaking with Youth A.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/16/2024. Staff 1 reported being told that he used “spicy
language” and used the “F” word in front of a youth. He denied
swearing and described the situation in the allegations. Staff 1
reported asking Youth A to not approach others and put Youth A’s
hands on others. Staff 1 reminded Youth A that Youth A is to
avoid others personal spaces. Staff 1 reminded Youth A as a
consequence of violating others personal spaces, Youth A could
lose 5-minutes of video gaming. Staff 1 laid out the expectations
for Youth A and “let it go”. Later, Youth A pulled another youth out
of his chair twice and Staff 1 informed Youth A that Staff 1 would
be speaking to Youth A’s direct staff about Youth A being unsafe.
Staff 1 reported telling Youth A that Staff 1 did not believe Youth A
should be allowed to play the video game at this time because of
Youth A’s unsafe behaviors. Staff 1 then walked Youth A to Youth
A’s room (at Youth A’s request).
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/16/2024. She reported being a direct supervisor for Staff 1. She
reported Staff 1 has limited interactions with youth but is attentive
to the youth. She has never heard Staff 1 swear around the youth.
3

Staff 2 was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/16/2024. She reported working with Staff 1 and has never heard
him swear at or around the youth. She reported never hearing
staff swear at youth in general. She reported Staff 1 interacts with
the youth and does not present as being disrespectful towards the
youth. She reported Youth A has a habit of negatively engaging
with staff and expecting staff to apologize to Youth A when Youth
A is acting out.
Staff 3 was interviewed at the facility face to face on
8/16/2024. He reported being the staff involved in the prior special
investigation (2024C0001148SI) and avoiding all swearing since
that incident. He reported not hearing Staff 1 swear at or in front of
the youth.
Documents Reviewed:
Incident Report dated 8/15/2024 for Youth A. This document
outlines the allegations as reported by Complainant.
Hope Network Staff-Persons Served Relationships dated May
1, 2024. This document outlines the different aspects of the
professional relationship between staff and youth (persons
served). It is documented that staff are to meet the highest
professional, ethical, and legal standards by reflecting youth
needs, choices, preferences, and individuality.
Hope Network Guidelines for Staff/Persons Served
Interactions without a date. This document outlines staff’s
behaviors beginning with the expectation that staff will serve as
role models, consistently exhibiting conduct that aligns with Hope
Network’s mission and values. Staff are to avoid any display of
hostility such as speaking in an angry manner, aggressive or
passive behavior used to maintain unnecessary control over
youth, obscene/profane language. Verbal expressions directed
towards youth should always be appropriate. Obscene/profane
language directed toward a youth is forbidden.
Hope Network Developmental Adolescent Residential
Treatment -Discipline dated 9/17/18. Staff are prohibited from
using verbal abuse, ridicule, or humiliation.
Hope Network Developmental Adolescent Residential
Treatment -Behavior Management dated 6/16/23. This
document outlines staff’s need to encourage participation in
following house rules by youth in the program.
4

Youth A individual safety & calming plan without a date. This
plan outlines the triggers for Youth A with three of the triggers
being providing redirection, being asked to respect physical
boundaries, and not having immediate access to something he
wants or having to discontinue a preferred activity. One of the
calming strategies to use is listening and validating his
perspective. Staff should not over-attend to Youth A’s negative
behaviors and provide redirection while monitoring him. Staff
should remain calm and speak calmly while offering Youth A
space.
Staff 1’s personnel file: Documentation indicates Staff 1 was
hired on 1/25/2024 and there is no disciplinary action documents
in the file. Staff 1 is current on his training.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as during interviews with youth
and staff all deny hearing Staff 1 swear or be inappropriate with
Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.

sir_summary.summary: A special investigation was conducted after allegations that a staff member (Staff 1) told a youth to 'get the fuck away from me.' The investigation, which included interviews with multiple staff and youth, found that no one could substantiate the claim of swearing, and the youth who made the allegation later revised their account. The agency's policies clearly prohibit such verbal abuse, but the investigators concluded the violation was not established. While the specific allegation was not proven, the report highlights a pattern of concerning interactions and prior incidents involving staff conduct at the facility.
